intro: Erodium ciconium var. turcmenum, commonly known as Turkmen eryngo, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces small, pink to purple flowers clustered in umbels. The plant is native to Central Asia and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It has a fibrous root system and is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening or as a cover crop.
